Description: Earthquake damage
Damage as a result of excessive ground water (including burst weather mains)
A genuine tornado, not high winds
Damage as a result of land moving (landslide or subsidence)

When a property or bush fire is the cause of an electricity fault. I.E. the Fire was underway prior to power supply being affected.  Note: We would often expect to see a Fire Comms Reference code for these Reactive requests
Confirmed lightning damage
Confirmed bird damage
Confirmed possum damage
Confirmed damage caused by animal/insect apart from Bird or Possum
Where trip cause is investigated & not found but protection element is closed and holds (including patrolled where appropriate)
If protection element is closed and holds, without investigating the cause
UG equipment damaged by a third party ie. not a Vector related party. E.g. thruster hits cable

Accidental contact with above ground assets by a third party (excluding vehicle). E.g. kite in lines, branch cut by third party contacts lines, non-vegetation debris in lines, pillar damage (except by vehicle)
Wilful damage, interference or theft eg. Graffiti, stolen earths
Asset damage caused by a vehicle
Damage caused by a third party not in the other subcauses; description of cause is mandatory
Instances where a protection element operated but no fault exists downstream; a result of faulty protection settings or the actions of a party working for Vecto
UG equipment damaged by a party working for Vector
Contact with above ground assets by a party working for Vector (including vehicle)
Where an error in the switching schedule/application results in an unplanned outage
Customer not notified of shutdown
Damage caused by a party working for Vector which is not defined in the other sub-causes; description of cause is mandatory
Where grass (excluding bamboo) or creeper has interfered with electrical equipment
Trees grown into asset or lines, tree has made contact with the line
Tree down
Loose debris has made contact with asset or lines
Roots have caused damage to the underground asset
Instances where mechanical damage/deterioration has required a device's replacement e.g. loose connection, broken cross arm, vibration,  poor seals
Failure of a device's electrical properties. E.g. Deteriorated insulation, bad contacts, flashover

Instances where installation irregularities have resulted in the asset not performing to standard. E.g. incorrect sag resulting in line clash, low lines, un-stayed pole leaning etc. May have met prevailing standards when installed.
Equipment malfunctioned due to corrosion or rot
Communications or control circuitry playing up
Where the protection system (including pilot lines) operates incorrectly
Failure of equipment due to contamination
Equipment defect that is not defined in the above defects
Select the most appropriate.  Where sub-cause is ‘Other – see comments’ an explanation must be provided in the activity comments
Select the most appropriate.  Where sub-cause is ‘Other – see comments’ an explanation must be provided in the activity comments
Select the most appropriate.  Where sub-cause is ‘Other – see comments’ an explanation must be provided in the activity comments
Select the most appropriate.  Where sub-cause is ‘Other – see comments’ an explanation must be provided in the activity comments
